website_summaries.verdict: A well-constructed line marker with wheels that can handle almost any field conditions.
pros: Model has 4 wheels, made from hard rubber to easily handle field conditions
cons: Some had challenges seeing where to start their lines because of the design of the machine's back

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the cheapest ones, but we were pleasantly surprised by how well it works. Leaves a nice thick line and it is so easy to use. Some soccer teams and clubs borrow it from us constantly because it works very well. We have had it for years now and it is still good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Club

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much as described, poor packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived with minor dents and scratches probably due to the poor packaging. I was going to ignore all that because it appeared it would function as it was intended, but we returned it in the allowed time because the need had gone away. We paid the considerable $$ return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: PlaneOldStuff

customer_reviews.title: Good Line Marker
customer_reviews.text: We use for several baseball fields. Did have an issue with one wheel falling up to had to buy a small cotter pin to replace the cap that fell off. That's the only cap that fell off out of the two markers we got, but it still seems like they're not quite sturdy enough. That said, it's still a good price and the marker works great. Haven't had any problem with leaking. Assembly took maybe 20 minutes, was pretty simple. The lever that changes the chalk line size on one didn't quite want to stay in place so it just had to be bent in slightly, no big deal at all.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Poor design...
customer_reviews.text: There is no cut out on the back tray so you cannot see where to start your lines! Get the more expensive model with the pneumatic tire (that's the one I had intended to get)... You won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The front wheels are a little stiff, hoping they loosen up after use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Poorly packaged from manufacture.
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived damaged, unit has scratches on the top, but works.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T Uhls

customer_reviews.title: Only lame people don't own a dry line marker.
customer_reviews.text: You never know when you'll need to chalk a line. If you live by that mantra, you'll want a dry-line marker. I used it out at an event, and the event coordinator asked if they could borrow it for their event the next week. "Sure... for $50!" This device could become a revenue producer for you. Heck, it could end up being your second job. Are you ready for that sort of responsibility? If so, buy this marker.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams
